1.Â Â Â Â Â Â The natural cooling of the water can be modelled using Newtonâ€™s law. I took a different approach by making use of actual measurements performed by Bosman, Grobler and Dalgleish at the North West University. Through simple regression analysis they derived straight line equations of losses versus water-to-ambient temperature difference. Their equations are useful because data was gathered from many systems at different temperatures, both with and without insulation. I could then set up a time series where I assumed straight line cooling over each one minute interval. One minute intervals are short enough to still capture the exponential nature of cooling without introducing much error.
